comment: Textbook available but not req. Took fluids over the summer and he made the lectures interesting enough to stay awake for 2.5 hours. Had weekly quizzes that were pretty easy and graded generously. I got a problem totally wrong yet made a 70 on the quiz just for showing work. offered xtra credit for submitting a folder with all quiz corrections.

He is my favorite professor. He does go fast and expects you to put in the work, but he is such a great teacher and knows the material well. He is very accessible outside class and will answer any question you have. You have to go to class and put in the work. He is a bit disorganized, but not as bad as some professors I have had.

Avoid taking this professor at all costs. He is very unorganized and doesn't respond promptly to emails. He went two weeks during the summer semester without posting any material for us to study. His tests were completely different from the final exams and he did not grade tests at all during the semester. Do yourself a huge favor and AVOID!
Avoid

Yee was decent for teaching the material. The tests were easy got A's on both and on all the homeworks too. Most of his quizzes were easy but some were random. I think he needs to post more on D2L such as uploading powerpoints and giving us more class updates. He also never uploaded grades to D2L. I'd take him again though, class itself was easy.
rating_tags: Respected--Skip class? You won't pass.--Graded by few things

comment: Prof Yee was a pretty tough professor although Fluid Mechanics is not an easy class either. He doesnt put any grades in until the last week so you dont know where you stand. The tests are nothing like the notes you take during class. He also doesnt give enough feedback on tests or quizzes to see what you did wrong. I would recommend a diff prof.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: it seemed like he had a lot going on this semester which led him to be a little unorganized. his tests are hard and i never knew how to fully prepare for the mc part. i still think he is a good professor though and he is a very nice guy. would ask me how work was going and talk to me outside of class. if you take him, be prepared. fluids is hard.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Graded by few things

comment: Very few examples in lectures. If you ask questions he dances around them, and reverts back to what he was showing you. Project has a 1 hr video, must use CAD, but then claims you don't need CAD. Tests do not reflect HW or Lectures. 1 page cheat sheet allowed for test. Stay away if you want to pass and not be stressed.

I took this professor for engineering fluid mechanics, his tests are MUCH more difficult than his lectures. He will admit that he doesn't teach for tests, he teaches in general and you are on your own as for guessing what is on the test. You'll need the book just to understand what is going on.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES

comment: Dr Yee is a very good professor tough grader but he knows his stuff. If you need help just go talk to him and he will help you. If I had anymore classes to take that he teaches I would take him.

Guys. This is my first time rating a professor because this one really deserves the rating. His class is very entertaining. He will make you understand the material and master it by the end of the semester. You have to work hard to get an A. But even if you get lower than A, you will still appreciate his teaching style and the knowledge. Go for it!

have taken 2 of his classes, and plan to take him for one more. He is one of the top 2 professors here for CE, and if you show up, pay attention, and try, you will learn and pass. Final project was a bit over the top, but the tests were easy.
Great professor. Really cares about his students. Had him for fluids and even though attendance is not required, I never wanted to miss a lecture!

He is straight forward and honest. Had him for fluids and Hydraulic analysis. Not much homework, and tests were manageable if you learned from quizzes and had a formula sheet. He is laid back, and takes time to make sure you get the material

I've not had  Yee for an undergraduate class, only a graduate level class-CE 6304-Advanced Hydraulics.  Yee seems like a pleasant fellow. I don't think that he was prepared to instruct at the graduate level. He certainly seemed enthusiastic about the material, but was horribly unprepared for class. He seemed somewhat intimidated by grad students.

Dr. Yee is an excellent professor. He is very engaging in class, and relates the material to real-world examples. His notes are very clear, and he presents the information as he would on a test or quiz. I highly recommend taking him if you have the chance. He may be tougher than the other professors, but you will defiantly learn something from Yee.

Yee is my favorite professor! His lectures are not only entertaining, but very informative. He is insistent on everyones success - unfortunately he will make you work for an A. Always available to help out, lots of chances to improve your grade, and you will leave the class with a real understanding of the subject. TAKE YEE!

Do yourself a favor and take Dr. Yee. He is very intelligent and a great teacher. He knows all his students by name and is invested in seeing them succeed. I took him a year ago and he still remembers my name. His class can be a little difficult only because he expects you to actually learn the material. One of the best professors on campus.

Professor Yee is one of the most attentive professors I've taken at SPSU / KSU. He knows nearly every one of his students by name, and can tell when there is confusion in the class, refusing to progress until he has alleviated it. He will create time in his schedule to help anyone, even holding a recitation period consistently.

Dr. Yee is one of my favorite professors. Go to lectures, ask questions, and do your hw. You'll not only pass but be very proficient in fluids. He's the Jackie Chan of college professors. No Bruce lee, but you'll leave happy, and a better person.

Yee is VERY energetic and passionate - easy to pay attention to during lectures. Attendance is mandatory & the class would get a pop quiz if someone skipped. Tests are tough, but he is generous when he can give partial credit (not on multi-choice section).  One of my favorite teachers! Phenomenal at explaining, and genuinely wants every1 to do well

Not a great professor. Had him for lab and he graded very harshly and inconsistent. Could not figure out what he wanted. Very difficult to follow his pre lab lecture and expected you to automatically know how to do the analysis for the labs without any explanation. The lab manual was terrible.

Really good professor at SPSU. Pop quizzes and tests can be pretty difficult, and he will make you work for it. But if you go to lecture and try, you'll learn a heck of a lot and be quite proficient at it by the end.

Dr. Yee is one of the best professors at SPSU. He is great at explaining things and is always available to help. He loves questions and really knows his stuff. He has an accent but it's not that difficult to understand. He can be pretty relaxed and funny at times. His grading is a bit tough at times but he is fair about it.

One of the worst professors ever. Prides himself on being a tough grader for the labs. One category is professionalism which he arbitrarily takes points off for. Thick accent can't understand a word he says. AVOID at all cost. His ego is so large that he wants you to bow and worship him. Not worth it.

He is super helpful and super cool. I absolutely loved that class. He is always available so if you need help you can always walk into his office. He grades lab reports kind of harsh, but 85 and over you will get an A.
Great
Mr. Yee’s lecture is very hard to understand. Does not know the Fluid Mechanics and he is a very bad grader.

He is very easy on grading the labs but if you really looking for a good fluid professor don't recommend to take his class. His lecturing is useless. He does not speak clear English, but he wants all the students to write an essay in lab. He is arrogant Instructor
He is very hard to understand,can not really teach the materials.He tries to be helpful during his office hours but he cannot really help.If fluid Mechanics is important to you , stay away from him.
He seems he is an OK person but he just cannot really teach. Please stay away from him!!

SIGN UP FOR HIS CLASSES!!!DR Yee is very caring and helpful professor. He wants you to help him help you. If he notices you trying, he will try to help you a lot. And he explains everything until everyone gets it. All I need to say is I can't wait to take another class with

Very good teacher overall. Attendance is not mandatory but he does take note who is in class and is trying. Covers a lot in class but if you visit his office hours he will explain if you still don't understand.
Very caring professor. Wants to see all succeed. Difficult class where you must keep up. Homework due every other week. Covers a lot of material in this class.
